Speech: Success comes to those who work tirelessly and never give up.
Shloka: Chapter 2, Verse 47 - You have the right to work, but never to the fruit of work.

Speech: One must perform their duty without attachment to the results.
Shloka: Chapter 3, Verse 19 - The wise perform their duties without attachment.

Speech: Fear is nothing but an illusion created by the mind.
Shloka: Chapter 2, Verse 56 - He whose mind is undisturbed by sorrow and free from desire is wise.

Speech: A wise man remains unaffected by praise or criticism.
Shloka: Chapter 5, Verse 18 - A learned person sees all beings with equal vision.

Speech: True knowledge comes from within, not from external sources.
Shloka: Chapter 4, Verse 38 - There is nothing purer than true knowledge.
